posts.text:
BREAKING: Every S&P 500 software stock is now trading below its 200-day moving average for the first time since the April 2025 bottom.

At the same time, ~89% of the Semiconductors & Semiconductor Equipment sector stocks are above this threshold.

This marks the biggest gap between the two sectors on record.

Both metrics moved in lockstep, hitting 0%, during the 2022 bear market.

As a result, the Software index has dropped -30% since November and is trading near its lowest since April 2025.

By contrast, the Semiconductor & Semiconductor Equipment index has been flat and sits near an all-time high.

Software stocks are more hated than ever.
posts.author: KobeissiLetter

posts.text:
You have never occupied the exact same space twice.

The sun isn't a stationary campfire—it’s a bullet tearing through the Milky Way at 500,000 miles per hour, dragging our entire world into the unknown.

posts.text:
EPA approval seems to be coming before month end according to Jim Alwood, whose full name appears to be James Alwood based on professional records, serves as the Supervisor (also referred to as Branch Chief or Acting Supervisor in some documents) of the New Chemicals Risk Management Branch 1 within the New Chemicals Division of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Office of Pollution Prevention and Toxics.

Nice work by Ronald below.  I haven’t personally verified but it seems like it’s legit
